DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to document that taking part in this program is beneficial for the child, its parents and local professionals. The study hypothesis are: Intensive training will speed up the childs motor, cognitive and social development. Intensive habilitation will increase the childs family's empowerment Children having participated in this intensive habilitation will speed up their process of development further than children in the control group The cooperation between first and second line health service is strengthened by participation in the intensive habilitation program The professionals in the first line(community)in Norway that participates in this program increases their empowerment and motivation
DOC.criteria: About three years of age Cerebral Palsy Multidisciplinary diagnosed Not have Pervasive Developmental Disorder (PDD) No Specific Speech and Language Disorders No Serious Sensory Defects
